Buy Something

Apple shows us how to clean your Apple products

Cube Owner is a discussion forum about the Apple G4 Cube. I never really wanted one of these but by the looks of the activity on the forums there’s loads of activity which is pretty wild considering this computer was never all the popular when it was new.

Macintosh How To How to speed up your Mac with a solid state SSD drive.

**The Brooks Review **writes about how the lack of a Magsafe power connector on the new Apple MacBook might not be that big of a deal after all.

**stratechery **TIDAL AND THE FUTURE OF MUSIC

**shawn blanc **celebrates four years of writing for a living

FlickSurfer is a great way to find something to watch on Netflix and allows you to search and sort by genre as well as sorting by rating from netflix, IMDB, Rotten Tomatoes, and an average of all the ratings

Tidal is a Cool Name. That’s About It. John Saddington opines on the new Tidal Music service.

Flamingo is a beautiful, native instant messaging client for OS X that supports Hangouts/Gtalk, Facebook, and XMPP.

FireFox the browser you love, is up to version 37

MacDrifter looks at Launcher for iOS

Desk.pm the fantastic looking writing software for Mac has seen an update to version 1.3 and offers a few new tweaks and features with a video to explain all. This software almost wants to make me buy a Mac again. (I’m currently on iOS only)

LowEndMac Mac of the day is the Centris 610. Memory Prices for this model are 72 pin SIMMS

TekRevue opines on how the new Surface 3 might not be the deal it seems at first look

MacWorld Kirk McElhearn gives a Windows phone a spin.

Drop For Mac: It’s Easier Than Dropbox The folks at Mac 360 explore Drop for Mac, which is supposed to be easier to use than Dropbox

Yosemite Macintouch notes some issues from users with Yosemite.

MacBook, MacBook Air, or MacBook Pro: Which Is the Best Value? Dan muses in the best value of the 2015 macbook lineup to date.

SEMrush SEMRush looks interesting. It shows you the traffic and keywords from your competitors.

The Secret History of the Apple Watch MacStories links to how the Apple Watch came about. An interesting read.

Finally: bringing Internet to my Colour Classic Riccardo Mori has some fun with internet access on a vintage Color Classic over at System Folder

Canon EF 11-24mm f/4 L Review Ken Rockwell reviews the Canon ultra wide zoom.

Why Amazon Cloud Drive Won’t Replace Dropbox or OneDrive TekRevue exlores the new Amazon Cloud Drive and why it might not be the Dropbox or OneDrive killer app.

How to stop Facebook from making your iPhone run like crap Here’s one more reason to ditch facebook, or at very least – a fix.

Apple Refurbished Deals Refurbished Macs from Apple are a MacBook Air from $809.00, MacBook Pro from $829.00 and refurbished iMacs from $929.00

Galaxy S6 Edge review: Innovative, impressive — and impractical JR Raphael at Computer World doesn’t think too much of the S6 Edge

Restart or reset your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch Hopefully you never have to use the reset option, but Apple shows us how to get your iPhone, iPad or iPod up and running again.

4 handy options for adding storage to your iPhone or iPad Macworld has some tips when you need more room for your iOS device.

With Galaxy S6 and S6 Edge, Samsung Tries to Regain Its Footing The New York Times makes a good points about the failings of Samsung’s new Galaxy Line.

Tip: Change Font Sizes On iOS Here’s a great tip how to manage your fonts on iOS from MacGasm

Flare2 is Half Price Icon Factory’s Flare 2 is now on sale for $6.99 and allows you to add effects and textures to your photos.

Throwback Thursday: “High capacity storage system” Apple World Today remembers a portable drive for the Mac that weighs just five pounds.

Drexel University installs iPad rental vending machine for students, library card holders Apple Insider reports on a new way to rent iPads.

Safari Search: iPhone and iPad how-to BGR shows us a neat tip on searching inside iOS using Safari.

Evernote for iOS Gets New Camera Mode MacStories notes on the new camera mode for Evernote on iOS.

Early Benchmarks Put Retina MacBook CPU Performance in Range of 2011 MacBook Air MacRumors notes that the 2015 Macbook isn’t really all that fast. (This news makes me want to check ebay for 2011 MacBook airs )

How to overcome a massive memory leak in OS X MacIssues writes about memory leaks and what you can do to avoid them

Hands On: TimeTag 4.0.0 (OS X, iOS) MacNN reviews TimeTag for Mac OS X and iOS.

Microsoft wades into the document scanning space with Office Lens for iPhone AppAdvice notes Microsoft’s new app that allows you to scan into Word and PowerPoint formats.

Google Glass and Doctors MacDrifter opines about whether doctors should use google glass.

7 ways to make your Mac boot faster. Macintosh How To shows us a few ways on how to speed up the boot times on a Mac.

Apple Watch Teardown iFixit takes apart an Apple watch.
